content:
The first Twttr users were
early employees and their friends and family.
On July 16, 2006, Twttr is launched for the public. In September, Twttr is renamed Twitter after the company buys the domain Twitter.com.
Twitter's user base tripled after its debut at the South by Southwest (SXSW) festival in March 2007, where it won a Web award in the "Blog" category.
User @chrismessina suggests using the #hashtag to group tweets.
Jack Dorsey (@jack) steps down as CEO, and Evan Williams (@ev) takes over.
Evan Williams steps down as CEO, and COO Dick Costolo (@dickc) takes over.
On its 6th birthday, Twitter announces that its user base as reached 140 million users sending 340 million tweets per day.
Dick Costolo steps down as CEO, and Jack Dorsey resumes as interim CEO. Twitter experiments with its interface during this period, with the customized timeline in 2014 to the Explore page in 2017.

At this point, our timeline gets sparse. Most of the popular first-name handles are already taken; the stragglers are private accounts who likely bought their usernames or re-claimed them after they became available.
Elon Musk acquires Twitter. Twitter started charging for API usage on February 9, 2023, and thus ends the data in this story.
